title: Double slit - y-max-2 - slit width w and spacing s

content.question: The figure shows a setup where light of wavelength <math alttext="lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>λ</mi></math> from a laser is incident on a plate with two narrow openings. Each opening has a width <math alttext="w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>w</mi></math>, and the centers of the openings are separated by a distance <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math>. The light forms an interference pattern on a viewing screen that is a distance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> away from the plate, as shown. What is the approximate distance – indicated in the figure by the question mark − between the centers of the central bright fringe and the second bright fringe away from the central fringe? Assume that small-angle approximations are valid for the fringes shown in the interference pattern.
